questions.question: A _____ is a very small component in a computer system that controls the flow of electricity and performs logic-based operations.
In binary hardware, OFF is represented by [____] and ON is represented by 1.
Why do computers process all data in binary?
options: Because binary is the fastest number system
Because electronic switches have two states, so data is converted into 0s and 1s
Because binary uses less memory than other systems
Because binary is easier for humans to understand
questions.answer: Because electronic switches have two states, so data is converted into 0s and 1s

questions.question: [____] is a base-10 number system that uses the values 0-9, and a bit is the basic computing element that is either 0 or 1.
Match each term to its position.
Each hexadecimal digit can be represented by exactly ___ binary bits.
Which benefit of hexadecimal is stated in the notes?
options: It runs faster on processors
It is shorter than binary and easier for humans to read, write, and check
It uses less memory than binary
It replaces binary inside the computer
questions.answer: It is shorter than binary and easier for humans to read, write, and check

questions.question: In 8-bit arithmetic, when does overflow occur?
options: When the result is negative
When the true result needs a ninth bit
When adding two even numbers
When the result contains all 1s
questions.answer: When the true result needs a ninth bit

questions.question: What happens to the extra ninth bit in an 8-bit addition overflow?
options: It is stored in a separate register
It is converted to hexadecimal
It is lost
It triggers a logical shift

questions.question: Binary addition is performed:
options: From left to right, borrowing from the next column
From right to left, carrying a 1 to the next column when required
By converting to denary first
Using hexadecimal intermediate steps
questions.answer: From right to left, carrying a 1 to the next column when required

questions.question: A [____] shifts bits left or right and fills emptied positions with zeros.
Match the shift direction to its typical effect on a positive 8-bit value.
According to the notes, what happens to bits that move past the edge during a logical shift?
options: They wrap around to the other side
They are lost
They are stored for later use
They are turned into ones

questions.question: How do you represent a negative number using two's complement as described in the notes?
options: Write the positive value in binary and flip only the MSB
Invert every bit of the positive value and add 1
Add a sign bit of 1 to the left without changing other bits
Subtract 1 from the positive value and invert only the LSB
questions.answer: Invert every bit of the positive value and add 1

questions.question: Match the sign bit to the meaning for 8-bit two's complement.
In 8-bit two's complement, the leftmost bit has a value of _____ for negative numbers.
